author: jih2nn
content:
Yeah without fulu fork epoch set, ethereum genesis generator doesn't set Osaka time, making EL doesn't think it's in Osaka fork even when it is.

With fulu and eip7805 forks set in the same epoch, it should work but Prysm currently doesn't. I'm currently working on it and almost fixed it. Will share working docker images soon.

author: jih2nn
content: But I think we do need to update ethereum genesis generator so we don't need to set fulu epoch. That's the whole point of rebasing eip7805 onto Electra. I wonder how others think about this.

author: mehdi.aouadi
content: Would be better imo. That's what has been done for epbs

author: pk910
content:
Uhm, that really depends on the implementation ðŸ˜„
We usually can't simply skip a fork as client implementations expect forks in the same order.

What we've done for epbs is, that we start from a electra genesis, so we can already activate epbs (which builds on top of electra) at epoch 1.
That speeded up the testing cycvles a bit as we don't need to wait for electra at epoch 1, just to activate epbs at epoch 2.

We can probably do the same for focil,  but afaik focil,is based on fulu? so it needs to go through the fulu activation first before focil can be activated?

author: jih2nn
content: We've decided to rebase focil onto electra as once fulu has PeerDAS, it would mess up with FOCIL

author: jih2nn
content: The issue is FOCIL changes EL and the new APIs are activated upon Osaka. If we can set Osaka time with eip7805_fork, it would resolve this?
